metadata.title: CVE-2017-11410 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark through 2.0.13 and 2.2.x through 2.2.7, the WBXML dissectorcould go into an infinite loop, triggered by packet injection or amalformed capture file. This was addressed inepan/dissectors/packet-wbxml.c by adding validation of the relationshipsbetween indexes and lengths. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of anincomplete fix for CVE-2017-7702.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11410` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
